DataElement.preferredName: Invasive Breast Carcinoma Histologic Laboratory Test Result Grade
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma that infiltrates the breast parenchyma.  The vast majority are adenocarcinomas arising from the terminal ductal lobular unit (TDLU).  Often, the invasive adenocarcinoma co-exists with ductal or lobular carcinoma in situ.  It is the most common carcinoma affecting women._The degree of abnormality of cancer cells, a measure of differentiation, the extent to which cancer cells are similar in appearance and function to healthy cells of the same tissue type. The degree of differentiation often relates to the clinical behavior of the particular tumor. Based on the microscopic findings, tumor grade is commonly described by one of four degrees of severity. Histopathologic grade of a tumor may be used to plan treatment and estimate the future course, outcome, and overall prognosis of disease. Certain types of cancers, such as soft tissue sarcoma, primary brain tumors, lymphomas, and breast have special grading systems._A modification of the Nottingham grading system for use in grading breast carcinoma._The outcome of a laboratory test._A modification of the Nottingham grading system for use in grading breast carcinoma._The degree of abnormality of cancer cells, a measure of differentiation, the extent to which cancer cells are similar in appearance and function to healthy cells of the same tissue type. The degree of differentiation often relates to the clinical behavior of the particular tumor. Based on the microscopic findings, tumor grade is commonly described by one of four degrees of severity. Histopathologic grade of a tumor may be used to plan treatment and estimate the future course, outcome, and overall prognosis of disease. Certain types of cancers, such as soft tissue sarcoma, primary brain tumors, lymphomas, and breast have special grading systems._A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A modification of the Nottingham grading system for use in grading breast carcinoma._A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A high combined histologic grade (unfavorable), SBR score of 8-9 points.

Concepts.definition: A high combined histologic grade (unfavorable), SBR score of 8-9 points.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An intermediate combined histologic grade (moderately favorable), SBR score of 6-7 points.

Concepts.definition: An intermediate combined histologic grade (moderately favorable), SBR score of 6-7 points.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A low combined histologic grade (favorable), SBR score of 3-5 points.

Concepts.definition: A low combined histologic grade (favorable), SBR score of 3-5 points.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A morphologic qualifier indicating that the grade of a neoplasm cannot be assessed.
